Name: OpenMRS Identification Number
Description: Unique number used in OpenMRS

Name: Old Identification Number
Description: Number given out prior to the OpenMRS system (No check digit)

Name: OpenMRS ID
Description: OpenMRS patient identifier, with check-digit

Name: HIV Clinic No.
Description: This is the patient's identifier used at the treating facility
Format description: The first three letters of the facility, followed by / then 5 numbers with no spaces

Name: Exposed Infant No.
Description: This is the exposed infant clinic number used at the treating facility
Format description: Either EXP/ followed by 4 numbers with no spaces for the EXP number or 01/16/001 (month/year/ number) for the Birth Cohort number

Name: Antenatal Care No.
Description: This is the unique serial number given to the mother during antenatal visits
Format description: Begins with 1 at the beginning of the financial year (July)

Name: Postnatal Care No.
Description: This is the unique serial number given to the child during postnatal visits
Format description: Begins with 1 at the beginning of the financial year (July)

Name: InPatient Department No.
Description: This is the unique serial number given to the mother during her stay in the maternity ward
Format description: Begins with 1 at the beginning of the financial year (July)

Name: HCT No.
Description: This is the unique serial number given to a client during HCT visits
Format description: Begins with 1 at the beginning of the financial year (July), has 4 digits followed by a / then 2 digits for the year

Name: National ID No.
Description: The Uganda National ID number

Name: ART Patient No.
Description: This is the ART number that is given to clients who have started ART
Format description: No specific format required as it varies from facility to facility

Name: Research Identifier
Description: An identifier used for patients within research settings

Name: Safe Male Circumcision Client Number
Description: An identifier used for patients who undergo safe male circumcision

Name: Refugee Identification Number
Description: An identifier used for patients with refugee status

Name: OpenEMPI ID
Description: Specifies UUID of the identifier type that is used as the Global Identifier Domain (GID) in the MPI. It is generated by the MPI and is persisted in OpenMRS.

Name: Patient Unique  ID Code (UIC)
Description: Unique Number that is auto generated on registration of a patient

Name: POIN
Description: Patient Organization Identification Number (POIN) the number that identifies a patient at a facility

Name: OPD No.
Description: Unique OPD Number that is generated on creation of the first OPD encounter

Name: District Registration TB Number
Description: Unique District Registration Number that is Assigned to every TB patient

Name: National Patient Health Identifier
Description: Tha National Patient Health Identifier for identifying a patient uniquely across the health sector

Name: Passport No.
Description: A passport Number for a patient

Name: RA/O Identifier
Description: This Identifier uniquely identifies a UPDF Soldier

Name: Laboratory Specimen Barcode
Description: A barcode number used for tagging specimens/samples in the laboratory

Name: Prisonemr Identification Number
Description: Prisoner Unique Number assgned on screening into prison

Name: Lodger Number
Description: Identifier of patients For patients who are lodging temporary

Name: Previous Prison  Number
Description: The Previous Prisoner Identification number in case is a transfer in
